intro: Cyrtandra framea, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Cyrtandra framea is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing nectar for native pollinators.
